thread.title: Ellwood City returns to the pumpkin patch with Oct. 24 parade
thread.title_full: Ellwood City returns to the pumpkin patch with Oct. 24 parade

author: mcrepp@ellwoodcityledger.com(mcrepp)
title: Ellwood City returns to the pumpkin patch with Oct. 24 parade
text:
Kevin Lorenzi/Calkins Media file Ellwood City Halloween parade: The tradition continues 
People line Lawrence Avenue during Ellwood City's 2014 Halloween parade. Oct. 24 is this year's parade day. Posted: Sunday, October 4, 2015 6:00 pm Ellwood City returns to the pumpkin patch with Oct. 24 parade 0 comments 
ELLWOOD CITY -- The annual Ellwood City Halloween Pumpkin Patch Parade will begin at 3:30 p.m. Oct. 24 and make its way through downtown. 
Those interested in marching are asked to register with Bette Baney DeLoia, parade chairwoman, at 724-752-9304 or 724-679-4210. 
Judging will take place at 3 p.m. the day of the parade in the Lincoln High School parking lot, where the parade will begin and end. All participants are asked to be in the parking lot by 2:30. 
There will be judging for floats as well as costumed marching groups and individuals. 
Monetary prizes will be awarded in four categories: ages 1 to 5, 6 to 10, 11 to 15, and 16 and older. 
Float prizes will be $125 for first place, $100 for second place, $75 for third place and $50 for fourth place. 
Prizes for costumed marching groups will be $50 for first place, $35 for second place and $25 for third place. 
The parade committee is in need of donations to cover the cost of prizes. All funds collected will be used for prizes. Donations may be sent to Bette Baney DeLoia, chairwoman, 705 Tara Drive, Ellwood City, PA 16117. Checks are to be made out to Ellwood City Holiday Parades. 
For safety reasons, there will be no throwing of candy. Walkers may hand out candy along the parade route. Only forward marching will be permitted, and the parade will not stop once it has started.
